benchmark_details.name: MCP-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: MCP-Bench is a benchmark for evaluating large language models on realistic, multi-step tasks that require tool use, cross-tool coordination, and planning/reasoning for solving tasks, built on the Model Context Protocol (MCP) connecting LLMs to 28 MCP servers spanning 250 tools across multiple domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous, standardized platform for evaluating the capabilities of large language models in handling complex, realistic tool-using scenarios across diverse domains.

data.source: MCP servers exposing 250 tools across 28 domains.
data.annotation: Automated task synthesis with human quality checks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics derived from direct evaluation of task outcomes and agent performances through rule-based checks and LLM judgments.
methodology.interpretation: Scores normalized on a scale to determine performance across various dimensions, comparing expected results with actual outputs.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is based on systematic comparison of LLM performances across multiple tasks and setups.

harm: Inaccurate task execution leads to incorrect conclusions.
